Kharbhooja Shrbat Recipe

Large Kharbooja - 2
fresh Orange Juice - 1/2 cup (strained)
fresh Lemon Juice - 1/4th cup
Khus Essence - 4 drops

1. Cut the kharbooja in to two halves
2. Cut the edges into zigzag pattern.
3. Cut where can i buy real viagra a thin slice off the bottom so that the melon stands upright without tipping (take care not to cut through the shell).
4. Scoop out the seeds and discard.
5. Scoop out the flesh and process in a blender, along with the remaining ingredients, until smooth.
6. Chill well and serve in the shells, if desired, with reversed lids and a straw

Pine Apple Coconut Milk Smoothie

Pineapple juice - 1 cup
Crushed pineapple - 1 cup
Coconut milk (fresh) - 1/2 cup
Lemon juice - from 1 lime
Ice - to top of blender
1. Blend ingredients until ice is slushy.\n2. Pour into frosted glasses and enjoy immediately.
Angoor Lasi

Cumin seeds - 1/2 Tea Spoon
Unsweetened yogurt - 1 1/2 glass
Crushed ice - 1 cup
Sugar - 4 Table Spoons
Seedless grapes - 1 cup (chopped fine)
Salt - A pinch

1. Heat a pan or griddle on medium heat and roast the cumin seeds till slightly darker and aromatic
2. Remove from heat, grind to a fine powder in a clean, dry coffee grinder.
3. Put the cumin powder (reserve a small amount to garnish the drinks), yogurt, crushed ice, grapes (reserve a small amount to garnish the drinks) sugar, salt into a blender.
4. Blend till smooth.
5. Pour into tall, chilled glasses.
6. Garnish with chopped grapes and a sprinkling of cumin powder and serve!
Almond Honey Milk

Blanched Almond - 1/4th cup
Milk - 2 cups
Cardamom seeds - 1/4 Tea Spoon
Honey - 3 Table Spoons

1. Place the nuts in a blender and process until finely chopped.
2. Add 2/3 cup milk and process until smooth paste.
3. Pour the milk into a heavy-bottomed pan and whisk the remaining milk.
4. Place the milk over moderately high heat and, stirring constantly, bring it to full boil.
5. Remove the pan from the heat and add cardamom seeds.
6. Place the pan over high heat and bring to boil.
7. Remove the pan from the heat and add honey.
8. Again place the pan over heat and bring the milk to just boiling point, pour it the strainer resting over a pan.
9. Pour the milk back and forth from one pan to another for at least a minute or until frothy.
10. Pour into warmed mugs and serve at once
Lemon Juice

juicy Lemon - 4
Water - 8 cups
Dates - 10 (pitted and halved)
salt - ½ Tea Spoon 
Honey - 1/3rd cup

1. Cut the lemons in halves crosswise, remove the zest from 6 of the halves and squeeze out the juice.
2. Slice the remaining lemons into thin rounds.
3. Place the water and the dates in a sauce pan and gently boil for ten minutes.
4. Add the zest and boil for another 2-3 minutes.
5. Remove the pan from the heat, stir in the honey, salt , lemon juice and lemon slices, and set aside, loosely covered, for 8-12 hours.
6. Strain through a muslin lined sieve.
7. Served chilled.
Apple Beet Cumcumber Juice

Apples - 2
Beet root - 1
Cucumber - 1
Lemon juice - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Coarsely grate the apples along with the peel and keep in a bowl
2. Grate cucumber and bet root in the similar manner and add to the grated apples.
3. Now keep them all in a juicer jar and grind till they become smooth juice
4. Strain the juice in to a bowl and add lemon juice to it
5. Pour in to the individual glasses and serve chilled
Basil/Tulsi Tea

Basil Leaves (Tulsi) - 1/2 cup
Water - 21/4th cup
Tea Leaves - 2 Tea Spoons
Sugar - To taste
Milk - As needed

1. Take a small tea pan and boil water in it by adding basil leaves.
2. Lower the heat and allow to brew for 3-4 minutes.
3. Now add the tea leaves and sugar as per taste.
4. Bring to boil.
5. Turn off the heat and strain it into cups and add milk as per your taste.
6. Now the healthy and tasty basil tea is ready to serve
Jeera Lassi

Curd - 3 cups
Cream - 2 Table Spoo
Lemon Juice - 2 Table Spoon
Ice-Water - ½ cup
Salt - To taste
Ice-cubes
Dry-roasted Cumin Seed Powder - 1/2 Table Spoon

1. Take a blender jar and place curd, the cream, lemon juice, ice water and salt in it and blend for 2 minutes.
2. Add ice cubes and blend for one more minute.
3. Add all but few pinches of cumin powder and process for 5 seconds.
4. Pour into chilled glasses, sprinkle remaining cumin and serve immediately.
Cardamom Milk Shake

Milk - 3 cups
Water - 1 cup
White Poppy Seeds - 3 Table Spoon
minced raw Cashews or Almonds - 2 Table Spoon
fried Coconut - 3 Table Spoon (shredded)
Sugar - 1/3rd cup
cardamom powder - 1/2 Tea Spoon

1. Take a Kadai and place the poppy seeds in it in low flame and dry-roast, turning often, for about 5 minutes.
2. Combine the poppy seeds , cashews or almonds , coconut and water in a blender and grind for 2-3 minutes or until the nuts are reduced to a fine puree.
3. Add 2 cups of milk and process on low speed for 15 seconds.
4. Pour the mixture through a strainer over a pan.
5. Press out as much as liquid as possible, then add the remaining milk and cardamom seeds.
6. Stirring constantly bring to boil over moderately high heat.
7. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes.
8. Now add the sugar.
9. Pour the milk back to forth from one pan to another until it is frothy.
10. Serve immediately
Apple Milk Shake

Apple - 2
Milk - 2 glasses
Sugar - 2 Table Spoon
Green cardamom - 4
Ice - as required

1. Peel the outer skin of the apple and cut in small pieces.
2. Now blend milk, sugar and apple pieces in a mixer.
3. Grind Elachi in to fine powder and mix in the shake.
4. Now the tasty apple milk shake is ready to serve
5. Pour shake in the glasses.
6. Put some crushed ice and serve it chilled
Tropicana Banana Yogurt Smoothie

Orange juice - 2 cups
Frozen ripe bananas - 2 (cut into pieces)
Fat free vanilla yogurt - 1 cup
Ground cinnamon - 1 Tea Spoon

1. Take a blender container and place orange juice and banana pieces in it
2. Cover and blend until smooth.
3. Add yogurt and blend frothy
4. Pour in to glasses and sprinkle with cinnamon.
5. Serve immediately
Lemon Pudding Recipe

Sugar - 3/4 cup
Corn starch - 1/4 cup
Milk - 2 1/2 cups
Egg yolks - 3 (lightly beaten)
Lemon zest - 2 Table Spoons (finely grated)
Salt - a pinch
Unsalted butter - 2 Table Spoons

1. Whisk the sugar and the cornstarch together in a medium saucepan
2. Add the milk and whisk until smooth.
3. Add the egg yolks, zest and salt and cook over medium heat until it gets thickened enough
4. Stir continuously over
5. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the lemon juice and butter.
6. Pour through a strainer in to a large serving bowl
7. Let it cool to room temperature.
8. Refrigerate it and serve chilled
Apple and pineapple Juice
Apples - 2\npineapple - 3 slices\nginger - pinch

1. Wash, quarter and core the apples
2. Remove the rind from the pineapple and cut in to small pieces.
3. Take a juicer jar and add apple pieces, pine apple pieces and grind
4. Take the juice in to the glass and add a sprinkling of ginger and stir
5. Now the tasty, tasty apple and pineapple juice is ready to serve.
6. Refrigerate it for at least an hour and then serve.
Musk Melon Jucie
Muskmelon - ½ cup (chopped and deseeded)\nSugar - 2-3 Table Spoon
1. Put 1/2 cup chopped (deseeded) muskmelon in a blender or juicer by adding sugar to it.\n2. Strain through a sieve.\n3. Start with a small quantity of this juice. Serve immediately
Cola Shake Recipe

Chilled Cola - 200 ml
Vanilla Ice-cream - 1 scoop
Sweetened Milk - 50 ml
Ice-cubes - 2

1. In a tall thin glass add a scoop of ice-cream.
2. Pour the sweetened milk over it and add ice-cubes.
3. Now very carefully pour the cola in the glass.
4. See it doesn’t flow out.
5. Serve with a spoon
Cold Coffee

Cold Milk - 4 cup
Boiling Water - 1 cup
Instant Coffee Powder - 6 Tea Spoon 
Cream - 4 Table Spoon 
Sugar - 3 Table Spoon
Crushed Ice

1. Dissolve instant coffee powder and sugar in boiling water and allow to cool.
2. Blend the coffee mixture and milk in a blender for few seconds.
3. Add cream and crushed ice.
4. Blend for another few seconds till it becomes frothy.
5. Serve chilled
